abstract.t: The Universal Character Set (UCS) [ISO10646, Unicode] covers a verywide repertoire of characters. The IETF, in [RFC 2277], requires thatfuture IETF protocols support UTF-8 [RFC 2279], an ASCII-compatibleencoding of UCS. The wide range of characters included in the UCS haslead to some cases of duplicate encodings. This document proposesthat in IETF protocols, the class of duplicates called canonicalequivalents be dealt with by using Early Uniform Normalizationaccording to Unicode Normalization Form C, Canonical Composition (NFC)[UTR15]. This document describes both Early Uniform Normalizationand Normalization Form C.
